author: Max Watman
title: Running With Runyon
text: There is a danger to writing a Runyonesque story, and that danger is Damon Runyon. Not only did Runyon write about the thoroughbred Stymie and his trainer, Hirsch Jacobs (“I have eavesdropped on him around the stables many a time”), but he was friends with Jacobs in the 1920s and ’30s, and Jacobs trained Runyon’s horses. The bankroll behind Jacobs was Isidor Bieber. Born in a Polish shtetl, Bieber hustled tickets on Broadway, owned a bar called The Paddock in Times Square, kept a stable of racehorses, was quick to anger and gambled like no one has ever seen. Like Runyon’s character The Sky, Bieber would bet everything...
